text: Duane Sauke is an American politician and member of the Minnesota House of Representatives. A member of the Minnesota Democratic–Farmer–Labor Party (DFL), he represents District 25B in southeastern Minnesota. ==Early life, education, and career== Sauke was raised in Conger, Minnesota by sharecroppers. He attended Luther College in Decorah, Iowa, graduating with a Bachelor of Arts in music education. He served in the National Guard. He was a band instructor for 17 years for several school districts across southeastern Iowa and later at Elgin Public Schools. He then became a real estate broker, later becoming owner of RE/MAX Rochester, which he sold in 2012. ==Minnesota House of Representatives== Sauke was elected to the Minnesota House of Representatives in 2016 and was reelected for a second term in 2018. He previously ran in District 26B in 1988, losing to Republican incumbent Bob Waltman. In November 2019, he announced he plans to retire rather than run for re-election in 2020. ==Personal life== Sauke married his wife, Debra, in 1972. They have two children and reside in Rochester, Minnesota. ==References== ==External links== * Official House of Representatives website * Official campaign website Category:1940s births Category:Living people Category:People from Freeborn County, Minnesota Category:Politicians from Rochester, Minnesota Category:Luther College (Iowa) alumni Category:Military personnel from Minnesota Category:Businesspeople from Minnesota Category:Educators from Minnesota Category:Members of the Minnesota House of Representatives Category:Minnesota Democrats Category:21st-century American politicians
title: Duane Sauke
